intro: Acinos montenegrinus, commonly known as the Montenegrin sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to harsh alpine environments. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually pink or white, adding a delicate touch to its rocky habitat. Acinos montenegrinus is often found in open slopes and meadows at elevations above 1,500 meters.
